Description: Upper body sherd of Attic red-figured pottery open vessel, probably a krater; interior glazed black; exterior: below junction with rim, red-figure decoration consisting of male figure wearing myrtle wreath (only bearded head with wreath, cloaked shoulder, and right arm with spear remaining) standing to left; at left, part of undetermined decoration, perhaps head of facing figure.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by The Petrie Museum of Egyptian Archaeology. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1129)
